meanings.definition: To establish in a new place or position.
meanings.sent1: She instals the new plant on the windowsill.
meanings.sent2: The technician instals the software on the computer.
meanings.sent3: He instals the toy car in the middle of the race track.
meanings.sent4: The artist instals her masterpiece in the gallery, capturing everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The chef instals the garnish on top of the dish, adding a final touch.

meanings.definition: To set up for use or service.
meanings.sent1: They instals the tent for the camping trip.
meanings.sent2: The team instals the new equipment in the gym.
meanings.sent3: The magician instals his props before the show begins.
meanings.sent4: The teacher instals a sense of curiosity in her students.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic instals the new battery in the car, ensuring it runs smoothly.

meanings.definition: To place in a particular position or location.
meanings.sent1: She instals the vase on the table, adding a pop of color to the room.
meanings.sent2: The worker instals the sign at the entrance of the building.
meanings.sent3: The child instals his toys neatly on the shelf.
meanings.sent4: The sun instals itself behind the clouds, signaling the end of the day.
meanings.sent5: The gardener instals the new plant in the garden, creating a beautiful landscape.
